comment: She was an alright professor. The work was heavy and it took a lot of time to complete, but she gives good feedback and explains the assignments well.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment:
Professor Visscher's teaching style was very effective. She uses a very engaging tone to explain her lectures. Also if you want a good grade in the class, she absolutely makes you work for it. Her class structure and strict grading policies have shaped me into a individual with much better work ethic before. 
Tip: DO NOT PROCRASTINATE IN THE CLASS
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Visscher is a great choice as long as you are not lazy. There is a good bit of homework and she expects you to write good essays to earn a good grade. While the assignments aren't necessarily easy, her lectures and guidelines are easy to follow. She also make sure that her lecture are interesting by adding fun group activities and games.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Prof. V. is very likable and understanding when it comes to cerian circumstances. She has some standards she wants you to follow, like no phones in class. She also wants you to email her if you're struggling so she can try and help by either extending the deadline or advising you as an individual. Beware of peer review day.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: One of the best teachers I've had. Her lectures are very enjoyable and engaging. There was weekly homework, but it was not difficult. As long as you care about your work and stick to the guidelines you should do well on your papers. Your attendance and doing your homework will also help your grade greatly. Only one group project as well.

She is honestly one of the best English professors I have ever had. She has an elite sense of humor so if you don't like humor I would not recommend. She is very lenient of homework assignments, but a tough grader on essays so be prepared for that. 

Brin Morgan

Professor Visscher is honestly an incredible teacher. She really cares about the students, and it shows. She will make you work for the A tho, so be prepared to write! Later essays are worth 20+ points and can range between 7 - 9 pages. All-in-all, Professor Visscher is the best English teacher I've ever had!

this is my fav teacher so far. i've taken her class and wish i can take it again ! she is so nice and explains what ever you need help with. i wanted to take her again but her class was all fill. take her ! you wont regret it !

Exceptional teacher. She graded our essays fairly and she gave constructive criticism on the essays for each individual student, and they were long papers. She worked really hard and wants you to succeed. If you do the weekly assignments, you'll do fine. Three essays: Personal Narrative, Casual Argument, and Rhetorical Analysis. Gives essay redoes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Great teacher. Makes you work for your grade. She is a very tough grader, but she is fair. She is funny and very helpful. The class is not a walk in the park, but I really feel like I am better with writing.

She is a harsh grader. but you get a chance to redo your first two essays if you fail them, she gives amazing feedback. All the readings and homework help with the essays. She seems scary, but is funny. Definitely makes you work for your grade. Taught me a lot

Gives lots and I mean lots of homework that sometimes feels pointless. Gives pop quizzes and other quizzes that are very difficult. Note-taking is required and measured which I don't find effective. Word count on essays is significant even if you're spewing nonsense just to reach the minimum.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: She has so much homework assigned every single class. Usually, she has about two to three things every class due by the next class. She is such a hard grader and she grades every single thing you do. She treats you like a middle schooler by grading everything down to your notes you take in class. She is rigid and won't change her grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Visscher is a great professor, I have enjoyed her class for this semester and would take her again. She has good activities and it engages my learning. She does give a lot of homework but it helped me become a better writer. I recommend taking her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is the best teacher I've had. Her lectures are very interesting and they make you want to write the essays she assigns. She gives great feedback, and even let's you rewrite sometimes. If you work hard, you get an A, but if you're like me and you slack off, you'll still be able to make a B.
She gives sooo much homework and with 4 papers throughout the semester. She grades hard and is very specific. Shes nice at some points but brutal in others. Its hard to get an A in this class
If you have medical leave, she will work with you and she does her best to help you
Best way to get an A is to send her a draft of your papers for edits. She will read them and helps you put in what she wants. Do this, and you will do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Visscher is great for ENGL1101! She is a tough grader, in her syllabus she put the rubric for how she grades our paper and a "C" paper is doing everything she asks for, so in order to get a B, it needs to be very well written and goes above the requirements. She is very understanding with problems students are having outside of class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Visscher is helpful and gives the you the opportunity to come in for help. But her directions are somewhat confusing, and she graded too hard on homework and in class assignments.  I got an A in my English 1101 class with a different teacher, but got a C in her English 1102 class.

Prof Visscher was unclear on her rubric. According to the rubric I had an A level paper but I was given a C. You can miss 3 times, 4 papers and a final paper and presentation. I WOULD NOT take her again because of her ridiculous grading. I got a C in the class which I didn't deserve. She gave a pop quiz or two to punish us. Good luck.

She is nice in class but HARSH grader. I made an A in ENGL1102 but a C in her class which says something. I tried very hard for every essay & did revisions to help my grade but it didn't do much. I got 100s on everything else but it didn't help either. I like English & write well but she made me feel horrible & hate the subject. Would not reccomend

Professor Visscher is a very nice person but when it comes to grading her criteria can be a bit unclear at times. She assigns nightly DBPs which are based off of articles. It's a useful way to keep your grade up considering you have to be very concise when writing your papers. I received all C's on my papers and she provided little to no feedback.

Ms. Visscher is an amazing teacher! Those who say otherwise did not take advantage of how helpful she is. If you are struggling with a paper, take your rough draft to her office and she will take you step by step on what to fix to receive and A on the paper. She makes you work hard, but in the end, I can say I am a better after taking her class.

She is an awesome human being, but takes her class pretty seriously. She is really young and the articles you need are relevant and interesting. She isn't boring and switches up her class alot. The important thing to remember is to ALWAYS ask questions because her instructions are unclear and always follow the grading rubrics for essays.

One of the worst teachers I've had, her directions aren't clear at ALL and make zero sense, even when you ask her to clarify something and you do what she says exactly she grades you harsh and tells you you did it wrong (when you did EXACTLY what she told you to do) she's very boring and annoying and not helpful at all. DO NOT TAKE HER

Ms. Visscher is very nice and cares about her students however she is a VERY tough essay grader and does not give a clear example on what the essays are supposed to be until after you have turned them in. There is basically nightly homework on D2L through Discussion Board Posts which are easy.
